text: The 1980 LPGA Championship was the 26th LPGA Championship, played June 5–8 at Jack Nicklaus Golf Center at Kings Island in Mason, Ohio, a suburb northeast of Cincinnati. Sally Little won the first of her two major titles, three strokes ahead of runner-up ==Past champions in the field== ===Made the cut=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Player || Country || Year won || R1 || R2 || R3 || R4 || Total || To par || Finish |- |align=left|Donna Caponi Young || align=left| ||1979 || 72 || 73 || 72 || 72 || 289 || +1 || T3 |- |align=left|Nancy Lopez-Melton|| align=left| || 1978 || 67 || 72 || 78 || 77 || 294 || +6 || T19 |- |align=left|Kathy Ahern || align=left| || 1972 || 72 || 75 || 73 || 78 || 298 || +10 || T31 |- | align=left|Sandra Post || align=left| || 1968 || 76 || 74 || 73 || 78 || 301 || +13 || T45 |- | align=left|Marlene Hagge || align=left| || 1956 || 72 || 79 || 75 || 77 || 303 || +15 || T54 |- |} Source: ===Missed the cut=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Player || Country || Year(s) won || R1 || R2 || Total || To par |- | align=left|Betty Burfeindt || align=left| || 1976 || 76 || 80 || 156 || +12 |- | align=left|Judy Kimball || align=left| || 1962 || 76 || 83 || 159 || +15 |- | align=left|Kathy Whitworth || 67 71 75 align=left| || 1967, 1971, 1975 || 83 || 78 || 161 || +17 |- | align=left|Louise Suggs || align=left| || 1957 || 82 || 80 || 162 || +18 |} Source: ==Final leaderboard== Sunday, June 8, 1980 {|class="wikitable" !
